The first function is the ‘main function’ and the second is the function called ‘functionOne’.  The main function is required before the program can be executed.  This is because it contains the instructions that cause the program to proceed in its operation.  In addition to that the program needs to have a second function: functionOne. This function should be passed to the main function. The main function will call this function each time it executes a loop.  The main function first asks the user to enter a value, then it calls the function that is passed.  The main function will pass this function to itself in an argument list.  This function should compare each item in an array to the entry parameter and count the ones that are equal to or larger than that parameter.<n>### Demonstraition:<n>Input:Input to the program:<n>main<n>52<n><n>-Write it in a loop while i<=52<n>-i=i+1<n>-if the entry is smaller than i then print (i-1) " is larger than your item"<n>  if-loop<n>  <n>Output:The output should be 1<n><n>### Input<n>Input to the program:main<n>29<n>10<n>-Write it in the loop while i<=50<n>-i=i-1<n>Output:The output needs to be a list of all the elements in the array.<n>### Description:After the two functions aforementioned have been implemented, the user should be able to enter a number larger than any of the ones in the array and the values of the array that are equal to or smaller than it.

Choices:  A: condition heart B: expend energy C: laugh D: stretch E: weigh<n><n>### Response:		<n>Your response should be written correctly with proper spelling, grammar and sentence structure, and should be clear to any reader.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Addiction to drugs or alcohol can lead to over consumption which could lead to health issues such as heart disease.<n>However not all people can afford to go to a gym and get in shape to work out to reduce stress.<n>So an alternative to working out to release stress that is affordable and accessible to everyone is exercise. <n>Some great ideas to exercise can be outdoor cycling, jumping ropes, doing jumping jacks or high knees. A simple jog outside.<n>Work outs do not have to be time consuming and should be done with a purpose such as to increase strength and balance or weight loss.<n>The American Heart Association suggests working out 150 minutes each week which if an addition to your normal work day, this number can be achieved.<n><n>If you are serious about quitting any addiction and you are having trouble doing it on your own, call 1-800-662-HELP for help which is a 24 hour counseling line.<n><n>### Resources:<n>The following resources will be used to help provide information on which to base your research, answer or solution.<n><n>The following [article](http://www.webmd.com/addiction-recovery/features/reasons-to-exercise) explains 5 reasons why one might want to exercise for stress relief.   <n>The [Centers for Disease Control and Prevention](http://www.cdc.gov/) offers information on ways to be more physically active.<n><n>### Credibility:<n>You are the creator of this submission.<n><n>### Notes:<n>There should be a minimum of 15 words in your response.<n><n>

This is a broad shallow valley with steep sides that is formed by glaciers or rivers.<n><n>### Inputs:What are the inputs?<n><n>### Response to Instructions:What is the output?<n><n>Sample Solution: <n>```<n>var output = 'The sum is'+ x +'+'+ y + '.<n>x = (b * c + d * c) / n +'and '<n>y = (n + a * b / (d * c)) / n + '.<n>```<n><n>### Explanation: <n><n>### Instructions: <n>In this instruction you are given two statements that are both true.  Determine what mathematical expression results from both statements.  Enter the expression in this format: A: 'The sum is '+' +'B: 'and +'.<n><n>### Instructs: <n>There are 8 possible answers.  Choose the best answer.<n><n>Sample Solution:<n>```<n>A: 3<n>B: 23<n>C: 23/2 = 22<n>D: 2 * 5 = 10<n>E: 5 * 4 = 20<n>F: 23 - 3<n>G: 20 + 3<n>H: 22 - 22<n>```<n><n>## Instruction: <n>Write an expression that computes the remainder after dividing 20 by 5.  What is the remainder of this division?<n><n>Sample Solution<n>```<n>remainder = 5 - div - 20 = 10<n>```<n><n>## Explanation<n>```<n>When the remainder is 5, the quotient (the first answer above) is 4.  Therefore, divide 20 by 4 and subtract from 20 to get 5. The answer is: 5 - 4 = 1.<n>```<n><n>## Input: <n>```<n>Enter the value of a: 1<n>Enter the value of b: 2<n>Enter the value of c: 6<n>Enter the value of d: 8<n>Enter the value of n : 6<n>Enter the sum of the first n terms of an arithmetic sequence (a, a + d, a + (2d), a + (3d)...: 6

After one player has made a bet, other players discard one card face up to replace their initial card and one card face down to replace their unseen card.  The winner of each round is the player who has the highest valued hand with one or more of their cards exposed.  The winner receives a share of the pot, which is the total amount of money put up by the players before the game started.<n>How many cards do all players have to start the game?<n><n>Answer: 10<n><n>## Instructions:Answer a question by creating a condition-if statement to matchthe given instruction based on the code shown.<n><n>## Rational:<n>Instructions: In any given hour, two or more vehicles wait in line at an intersection and travel through it.  Cars, however, do not travel through the intersection in a constant stream: a car does not leave the intersection, one car at a time, and the next car that could enter the intersection comes to a stop for a red light at some moment.  Vehicles travel through the intersection randomly - any given vehicle can enter the intersection at any time. To determine how many through-car drivers go through the intersection during a period t (denoted as t minutes) the formula (t + 1) * 2 / 3 * 20 / (20 + (t * 10)) is used as shown.<n><n>Input: Given a variable t (t minutes) that represents the total number of minutes that a given traffic intersection is red. What happens if t is increased by 5?<n><n>Answer:<n>The formula changes from (t + 5) * 2 / (3 * 20) to (t + 6) * 2 / ((3 * 21))<n>Therefore if 5 more minutes is added it equals 1<n><n><n>## Instruments:<n><n>1. <strong>Evaluação</strong><br><n><n>2. <strong>Comandos adicion

Other buildings fall into one of the other categories such as building that are underground, high, big, or small.<n><n>### Input<n>How do I show my command of the conventions of academic English<n><n>### Response<n>How do I show command of the conventions<n><n>### Input <n><n>### Response <n><n>### Input  <n><n>### Output<n><n>### Output:  <n><n>### Input

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: happen to people B: hurt people C: happen anytime D: happen often E: happen anywhere<n><n>### Response:		<n>*This is the question I did, but got wrong*<n>The answer I am looking for is (B) hurt people<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>The question is asking us to evaluate whether accidents hurt people or not. The answers given are A, B, C & D. These are incorrect as the wording should not be interpreted to mean that these occur in an everyday setting, or only when people get into accidents. The phraseology itself, "in their area", should be interpreted to mean that this is only happening in his/her area, which narrows it down to only (B) hurt people.<n>

For example, you could ask the user for the numbers "1", "1", "1" and "1" respectively. The program will calculate the greatest of the four numbers that were entered. An example input is 6, 3, 5, 1. The greatest of the four numbers is 6. So, if given the same example input as above, the programm should say "What is the greatest of these numbers? 6".<n><n>### Hint: Create a function that will return the greatest of the numbers you have passed into it as a parameter. Refer to the Tutorial [1] found at the beginning of this lab for a more extensive explanation of the `greatest()` function that you have created.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: 42, 98, 74, 86<n>Output: The greatest of 98, 86, 74, and 42 is: 86.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demos<n>Input:What is your home’s greatest room?<n>Output: The greatest room in my home is: dining room. Choices:  A bedroom B living room C kitchen D dining room E bathroom<n><n>Input:What is the greatest number among 200,32422,4,2,0202? (The input and output numbers in the question below are random and do not reflect actual input/output in your program. The only goal is to get your program to calculate the greatest number.) Choices:  A 200 B 1739 C 718547 D 1098 C 4100<n><n>### Output<n>Choices:  A bathroom B family room C living room D bedroom E hallway<n><n>### Instructn/Output:<n><n>### A: 200 or 300<n><n>## Question A:How can I call the program that I wrote, and then pass in the command prompt (CMD.exe) as a parameter?

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>### Input:A person writes a check to a clerk, where does the clerk put them? Choices:  A: cash register B: desk drawer C: pay envelope D: throw away E: box<n><n>### Response:		D<n>### Explanation:<n><n>- 6.1A:The clerk typically puts the check in a pay envelope and sends it through mail.<n><n>- 6A3: The clerk places  the check in the cash register<n><n>- 6B2:The clerk places the check and other items to make cash for the day.<n><n>### Input_output:<n>Input:The car-rental ag...<n>Input:A hurricane is appr...<n>Input:Jason has a carrous...<n>Input:Melissa works on a...<n>Input:The ratio of boys to...<n>Input:A person writes a...<n>```<n><n>Output:<n><n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. There was a target on the wall for him to bounce against.  Where might he be? Choices:  A: pool table B: toy box C: playroom D: park E: closet<n><n>### Response:		The number of children in the house is 200, and he was given 1025.  The number of days in 1 yr = 365.  The number in children in the house = 25, The ratio of boys to everyday in the year is the same as the ratio of boys to everyboy in a family = 5:7.<n>Hence, the first number is 5 and boys were given 1024 (52)<n><n>### Input<n>How long will it take the car 60 miles at 60 miles a hr ? The answer is 1 in day<n><n>### Input How long will it take the hurricane 60 miles at a certain speed rate, the answer is 10 in month<n><n>### Input <n><n>What is the total driving time or time of travel of a horse drawn carriage or traveler to 400 miles.<n>The answer is 5 hr<n><n>### Input Number of children in the family = 200<n>180 was given to him he got 52 dollars.<n>He got 3 hours to drive because 52/365=.0588<n>Hence 365(0.0588)= 2.22<n><n><n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>### Input:What European country is famous for its potato industry? Choices:  A: idaho B: casserole C: new hampshire D: root cellar E: ireland<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is: (B)--Casserole;<n><n>### Explanation:<n>In the example: If you want to find E’s house, first, find F’s house. F’s house is 6820 ft from E’s house.  Therefore, E’s house is (6820 ft / 2) feet from F’s house.  Since we know that we want E’s house, we can substitute the numbers in the statement into the problem.  (6820 / 2, ft = 3410, ft / 2 = 1705 ft, 100 / 2 = 50 ft)<n><n>### Input 2:<n>I will be going 250 miles today. I will be spending 12 hours driving.<n><n>### Response 2:<n>  I will be arriving at 5 pm tomorrow. (12 hours × 5 = 60 min.) * 1 day = 24 hours<n><n><n>### Instructions:Create a function that has a parameter named x.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Output<n><n>###<n>    function sum(x){  4 + 1  <n>}<n>    function square() {    function square(x) <n>}<n><n>### Input x = 4<n><n>### Output square(4) = 16<n><n>### Instance:<n>You wish to compute x + y.  Write a function that does this.  A function to compute x+ y would have a parameter named _x and the name of the function would be _add.<n><n>### Write the function:<n>Input:x=4; y=1<n><n>Output:add(x,y)=5<n><n>### Instances: (25,1)=26  and (10,5)=15<n><n>### Examples:<n><n>### x = 313<n><n>### y = 7<n><n>### z = 97<n><n>### Output:<n><n>#### 30  to<n>#### 31  to<n><n>#### 32  to<n><n>### Instantions:<n><n>#### x=258  <n><n>###<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>### Input:What is likely to happen to someone's speech after becoming inebriated? The flight is full of people and weighs 14000 pounds when fully loaded. When the flight is fully loaded, the fuel weight is 2000 pounds. What percent of the airplane is empty on takeoff?<n><n>### Input<n><n>- 47 passengers<n>- 1400 pounds total weight = 1400 * 2 pounds = 2800 pounds fully loaded<n>- 2000 # pounds = 200 pounds of fuel = 200 / 2800 * 100 = 7.1%<n><n><n>### Instruct:What is the weight of the airplane?<n><n>### Dem:Weight = 560 pounds<n><n>### Input#: There are 24 students in a classroom. E is the worst possible choice and A is the best choice<n><n>### Input : A small dog can usually only carry 200 pounds. The largest mammal that can survive on land is the elephant. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>### Input:We were having a canned food drive and I needed to pick up some contributions, where did I go? Choices:  A: shelf B: cellar C: refrigerator D: cupboard E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		I will look in the cellar.<n><n>### Input:[Jason] is a good worker and always gets his job done on time. I wonder what he does when he finishes his work? Choices: A: I never thought about this. B: He plays. C: He plays with his son. D: He cleans up. E: He reads.<n><n>### Response:[He reads]<n><n>### Input:(Shooting) Range: A: 45 B: 60 C: 100 D: 90 E: 67 Choices: A: 60 B: 80 C: 40 D: 300 E: 10<n><n>### Response:(Shooting)Range: 60<n><n>### Input:@"How many days are there in a year?"<n>Choice:  42<n><n>### Response:"There are 42 days in a year."  <n><n>![task](./images/homework_tasks.jpg)<n><n>[1]: https://github.com/DanaShields/homework-python-2/blob/main/Assignments.md

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Add examples and any necessary context (if not covered in the example).<n><n>### Other Information<n>Include further instructions if necessary:<n><n>### Reference<n>For any questions you may have, refer to this page on [reference](./3-Task-Description/Reference.md)<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>### Input:What city in the middle east is known for a temple? Choices:  A: jerusalem B: texas C: middle east D: china E: india<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input<n><n>**What is the smallest natural number?**<n><n>**Answer:** 0<n><n><p>The smallest natural number is 0 since all other natural numbers start with 1.</p><n><p>All that is needed to start a natural number is a "1", so the lowest natural number is 0.<n><n>For example, the smallest natural number is 6. It is followed by 7 and 8. The smallest<n>natural number is 0, it is followed by 1 and 2. After 5, the next smallest natural<n>number is 0. All natural numbers in the set of natural numbers are either<n>positive or negative.</p><n><div><n><blockquote><n><cite>Source: https://www.reddit.com/r/AskReddit/comments/d2m9ua/what_is_the_smallest_natural_number/</cite><n></blockquote><n><p>**What is the largest natural number?**<n></p><n><p style="text-align: justify;"><n>The largest natural number is <b>1<n>(primes don't exist, because 1 is the largest natural number).</b> Natural numbers are<n>universe of whole numbers that begins with 1 as the base that does not contain any<n>negative numbers. This means that all positive whole numbers are natural numbers.<n>The set of natural numbers begins with 1.<n><n>The set of natural number is a non-empty set whose successor is not a member of<n>itself. It is not possible to express natural numbers as a sum of positive integers.<n></p><n></div><n><div>https://www.reddit</div><n><blockquote><a href="https://www.red<br /><n>div>https://www<h4>div>https://www<n><n>

The farmer has decided to sell his corn by the bushel, but the exact number of bushels can differ by as much as 3 percent from year to year depending on a variety of other factors, such as the amount of rain received during the growing season. However, he estimates that the average bushel produced by the farm is 52.22 bushels. The farmer charges $3 75 / ton for the sale of all of his corn during one year. What total price did the farmer receive for his corn during the year?<n><n>### Answer: 21396.5<n><n>### Input :  How many different license tags that are 6 characters long are possible that don't start with 0?<n><n>### Demonic: The only 2 digit digits that are valid license tags, are: 00-09 and 10-19. There are 19 of them. So, there are 18 of them with no 0s, but the 1's can come first or last. So, there are possible with different first letters. 7 of them begin with A or D. There are also possible letters as third characters. There are possible with different fourth letters. But, there is only one fifth letter, which is S. Then, there are only 6 different 5th letters with possible choices.<n><n>### Response :5613. <n>

Choices:  A: new hampshire B: dairy farm C: farm field D: texas E: county fair<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: Farm field<n><n>### Why did you make that selection?<n><n>I chose "Farm Field" because New Hampshire was incorrect. I chose "County Fair" because I know New hampshire is in New Hampshire. I chose "Dairy Farm" because dairy is a thing that is at New Hampstire. I chose "Texas" because i thought New hampshire was like 6hrs form Texas<n><n>### Instructions: If we change the initial input, how might your answer change? Write some sample inputs and corresponding outputs here.<n><n>```<n>I would have chosen the same answer. <n>```<n>

What is the total pay per day for 14 days when the pay is $50/day or $500?<n><n>### Response<n><n>- $ 400<n>- $ 700<n><n>### Input :<n><n>>   How much does it cost to move 500 head of cattle?<n><n>### response<n><n>- A<n>- B<n>- C<n>- D<n>- E<n>- F<n>- G<n><n>### Input ::<n><n>>   1) The ratio of boys to girl in a family of 20 boys and 25 girls is 3:5.  The total amount of money spent by all girls for groceries for 2 weeks is 480.00 dollars.  If the boys are given 480.99 to share, how much does each boy receive? <n><n>### response :<n><n>- $ 68<n>- $ 75<n><n>### Input::<n><n>>    1. What does the number on the scale measure? Choices: A) the length of a line B) the thickness of the line C) the weight of an object D) the number of objects E) the temperature of an object<n><n>### response::<n><n>- C<n>- B<n>- A<n>- D<n>- B<n><n>### Input:-<n><n>>   1:-The length of the scale and the tick values are proportional so the measure that scale measures is the weight.<n>2:- The tick values on the scale measure how many multiples of the unit of the ticker. So, If I read the scale at 8 it will read on the tick that 8/1 is 8 so the measure that the scale measures is the weight/unit.<n><n>### response:-<n><n>The length of the scale is proportional to the tick values. So it means it measures weight.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: The ratio of boys to girls in a family is 5:7. The total number of children in the family is 180. If the boys are given $3900 to share, how much money does each boy receive?<n>Answer: 52<n><n>### Input:What is the opposite of a village? Choices:  A: rural area B: africa C: ohio D: big city E: tribe<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Answer: E <n><n>#### Explanation: The answer is 'E'.A village is an inhabited area smaller than a town.  So a village's opposite would be inhabitated area larger than a town, and 'big city' fits this better.If a city is larger than a town, wouldn't a village then be inhabatted?

A tank would protect me from all of the cannon balls that would hit my body and I would not have to worry about getting hurt. Even if there are multiple cannon balls being fired at once, the tank would protect me. The bombs and cannon balls would be incapable of destroying a tank.

Choice D is incorrect because you are renting the apartment for less than 3 years.     Answer D<n>

Choices:  A.  a bag of potatoes and 2 onions, a couple oranges and a bag of apples B.  a bag of 2 onions and 2 apples, a bag of 10 potatoes, and a couple of oranges C.   a couple of oranges and a bag a potatoes and a few onion's D.  some baggs of potatoes with a few onions, the rest is a few apples and some oranges<n>E.  some of onions and a couple of apples with a few potatoes and some oranges<n><n>Answer:<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following questions.<n>Your pet goldfish may be able to detect the presence of land mines by smelling explosives lurking beneath the ground.<n><n>The [Venomous Sea Snakes of the Indian Ocean](https://www.theguardian.com/science/2016/oct/18/the-hairy-vipers-the-venomous-sea-snakes-of-the-indian-ocean) can survive for more than a week without oxygen. Scientists are not sure how. How do they survive? Do some research on how they survive and then post a picture that best represents their survival.<n><n>### My Pet goldfish can detect the presence of landmines by smell, and it does this because they sense explosives particles in the surrounding soil. They sense explosives by the odor that is associated with explosives.<n><n>### These sea snakes have adapted to exist in an environment with little accessible oxygen. Because of this, they have developed an extended gill rakers and larger lungs that allow them to get more oxygen. They also produce an enzyme in liver that breaks down sulfur in the blood, and stores it in the muscles. When needed, the body breaks it down and uses it as oxygen to keep itself alive.<n><n>### [How Do Sea Snakes Breathe underwater](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3422378/)

Choices:  A: obtaining information B: exchange of ideas C: sharing information D: conversation E: gathhering of information<n><n>### Response:		Choice: Conversation<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>If you would like to contribute a question of your own or respond to one of the previously answered questions, please take the time to create a test by following the instructions on the project template. If the question you choose is one that you created, please make sure that it is in the proper format, has sufficient detail to answer and gives the student the right level of difficulty. If your question is a rework of a previous question, make sure that you have fully edited each answer to show that you have completely understood the question and how to properly answer it.<n><n>Here's an example of a simple instruction that provides the right level of difficulty for its level in the course:<n><n>- Instruction:<n>  - Type:<n>    - What:<n>      - Question:<n>        - Answer: One should always ask the person for whom they are typing to proofread.  <n>  - Type: What<n>- Response: Choice: What you asked<n><n>The above instruction has a single question with two choices, so it is an example of a type of instruction at level 4.<n><n>In each case, you should also give the expected value as follows:<n><n>Expected Value:<n><n>This is where you can add your own description on whether the response is a good or incorrect response, or why a correct response should look different from an incorrect response, or simply provide an exemplar solution for one of the choices.<n><n>You can use the "Markdown" feature to provide additional instructions for students as they respond. A good practice is to also include a markdown code to provide a simple example of how to answer the question. Here are the markdown codes:<n><n>### Level 1<n><n>Question: What is an example of a correct response for each answer choice?<n>		### Answer Choice 1 (Level 2, Type: Input)<n>		### Response: Choose a or b<n><n>### Instructor Markdown<n><n>_Here is a nice example in Markdown 2, type Markdown 3, and Markdown 4 with_ **Markdown 1** _as well._<n>
